description: Ripe plantains sliced and deep-fried until the edges are crispy and caramelized, while the inside remains soft and sweet. A simple, delicious, and addictive street food snack.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: While roasted gonja is more common, deep-fried gonja is a beloved treat found in markets, roadside stalls, and homes. It's a quick way to prepare plantains, resulting in a different texture—crispy on the outside and meltingly soft inside. It's often sold in paper cones and enjoyed as a quick, energy-boosting snack.

ingredients.name: Ripe Plantains (Gonja)
ingredients.notes: Skin should be yellow with significant black spots for optimal sweetness. Very ripe but not mushy.

ingredients.name: Vegetable Oil
ingredients.notes: For deep frying (enough for 1-2 inch depth in a pot)

steps.instruction: Peel the ripe plantains. Slice them diagonally into 1/2-inch (1-1.5 cm) thick pieces. Diagonally cutting creates a larger surface area for more crispiness.
Heat the vegetable oil in a deep pot or wok over medium-high heat until hot (around 175°C / 350°F). The oil is ready when a small piece of plantain sizzles vigorously upon contact.
Carefully lower a batch of plantain slices into the hot oil. Do not overcrowd the pot; fry in batches for even cooking.
Fry for 3-5 minutes, turning occasionally, until the gonja pieces are golden brown and the edges look dark and caramelized.

cooking_indicators.visual: Golden brown with darker, crispy edges.
cooking_indicators.texture: Crispy exterior, soft and sweet interior.

steps.instruction: Use a slotted spoon to remove the deep-fried gonja from the oil, allowing excess oil to drip back into the pot.
Transfer them to a plate lined with paper towels or a wire rack to drain and cool slightly.
While still warm, sprinkle with a little salt if desired. The contrast between the salty exterior and sweet interior is delightful.
Serve the deep-fried gonja warm as a snack or side dish.

serving_suggestions: Enjoy on their own as a snack. They also make an excellent side dish for grilled meats, fish, or stews. Can be served with a dipping sauce like a spicy chili sauce or a cool yogurt dip.
